{"step_by_step_thinking": "Peau d'Orange, which translates to 'orange peel', is a term used to describe a symptom of breast cancer where the skin of the breast starts to appear pitted, similar to the skin of an orange. This is caused by the build-up of fluid in the breast, which is a result of the obstruction of lymphatic ducts. The lymphatic system is responsible for draining fluid from tissues, and when this system is blocked, it can lead to the characteristic 'orange peel' appearance.", "answer_choice": "B. Obstruction of lymphatic ducts."}
